summary: Okay, I'm not the first person to talk about double standards towards Daenerys. But today I decided to watch posts with...
body:
Okay, I’m not the first person to talk about double standards towards Daenerys. But today I decided to watch posts with characters whose actions deserve criticism much more than Dany’s actions, but found nothing. And I don’t even know if I’m angry or funny about it…But why is killing your enemies in war considered more cruel than killing innocent children? I just want to remember the evil deeds of the characters that everyone loves (including the haters Daenerys), but that doesn’t mean I’m a hater of the characters I’ve listed (I love Jaime and Theon, and Braime is my favorite ship in this fandom).

And well, since I’ve already mentioned this character…

Jaime Lannister

And his first evil act we get in the first series of the first season (or in first book). I think everyone has already understood what I mean: he pushed the child out of the window, causing the child became disabled.

He tried to kill an innocent boy, but it’s less horrible than revenge for crucified children, isn’t it? If that’s what you think, I don’t even know what to say.

Jaime could have captured the stark soldiers along with Eddard, but instead he gives the order to kill everyone but Ned.

But Daenerys, who attacks the army of her enemies when she began to lose the war, is more cruel?

Jaime killed every last one of them, while Daenerys gave the vanquished a chance to join her, and all but two people are alive.

Also recall that the show writers have attributed Jaime killing his cousin, who admired him, and rape Cersei at the corpse of her son.

Theon Greyjoy

No doubt Theon is one of those characters who has the cruelest fate, but today we’re talking about crimes that are forgotten, right? And Theon is the character who has them.

He betrayed Robb and the other Starks, the people he grew up with.

He attacked Winterfell on his own initiative and forced Bran to surrender the castle.

On the show, he beheaded ser Rodrik (although he promised Bran he wouldn’t do it).

He killed and burned two children to pass them off as the dead Bran and Rickon.

In the books, he had a mistress, whom he once left the bites and bruises.

In your opinion, cheating and killing Kraznys and other Masters of Astapor (to free slaves) is worse than the actions of Theon?

Cersei Lannister

You may be surprised, because most of the fandom has already recorded her in the Mad Queen, but when I tried to find posts “Anti Cersei” I came across only two, and one of them was also “Anti Daenerys”.

In many posts, I see AntiC saying that Dany will become a Mad Queen, that her desire for the throne will go too far…but what they attribute to Dany has already happened to Cersei.

summary: Suck the Water in my Chest (Cross My Fingers and Hope for the Best) - callmejude - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Suck the Water in my Chest (Cross My Fingers and Hope for the Best) - callmejude - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
“You shared beds at the Wall?”

“No, I just mean —” Jon starts, before he notices Theon is smirking at him.

Jon feels abruptly light, and a laugh bursts surprised and genuine from his chest. Theon ducks his head, but Jon can see a hint of a smile still on his face as he lifts the rest of the bread to his mouth.

summary: [NO SPOILERS] Game of Thrones Fantasy League
title: [NO SPOILERS] Game of Thrones Fantasy League
body:
I may be getting a little ahead of myself, but since fantasy football just ended and season 8 starts in April I figure this is a good time. Some buddies and I came up with a rudimentary Game of Thrones Fantasy League. Yes I know GoT is already fantasy.

The set up is basically the same as fantasy football where you pick a “player” for each position. Everyone gets a Leader, Hand, Warrior/Executioner, Champion, Beast, Liability, Army and House. Points are awarded (or deducted) for kills, successful scheming, dying, resurrecting, screen time, having sex, changing sides, fulfilling prophesies, winning the iron throne, etc. I broke everything down in an Excel spreadsheet. I can link it when I get home and off mobile if anyone is interested in starting a league of there own.

In addition to choosing a “team” (idk what else to call it; house?) I asked everyone to create their own house sigil and motto.



Source: http://bit.ly/2D35Nzy

The set up is basically the same as fantasy football where you pick a “player” for each position. Everyone gets a Leader, Hand, Warrior/Executioner, Champion, Beast, Liability, Army and House. blog.name: frillyfacefins
blog.title: Elf Smut Central
blog.description: Hey guys! I'm Ludo, and this is my clusterfuck of a multi-fandom-blog :D I've started as a homestuck blog, so you'll still find some sediments of that here, but now I'm mainly lolling around in the Star Wars, Silmarillion/general Tolkien, Dragon Age and MCU Fandoms. The only thing I ever actively contribute to any of my fandoms is fanfic. Dirty, dirty fanfic. If anything I write has more than two chapters and is a WIP, it likely won't be finished. Except if there's something like 'Chapter 4/7', that means that I've not been as lazy as usual and even finished the fanfic before I posted it, wohoo! Generally there might be a bit of NSFW on my blog, but there are also a lot of sexy dudes, pretty ladies, lovely kitties and everything else I find interesting :) (also, I like feminist discourse and general social justice stuff, so there'll be some of that here too)

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: So I just realized something
title: So I just realized something
body:
Remember, at the end of A Game of Thrones, when Arya was catching pigeons in King’s Landing to exchange for food?

According to everything we know about Westeros and the Free Cities… There couldn’t possibly have been any pigeons in King’s Landing… Wild.

summary: One Good Thing to Come of Wishes and Hopes - theoldgods - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
title: One Good Thing to Come of Wishes and Hopes - theoldgods - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
“Your Grace.” Davos’s knees protested as he knelt, but this was Robert the First of His Name, King of the Andals, the Rhoynar, and the First Men, and however else it went, and his lord’s elder brother in any case. “It is good to see you well, and my wife and I are honored that you would have given us any thought at all.”

“Not think of the onions? That would be cruel, Ser Davos.” The king’s grasp on his shoulder was powerful, pushing him further into the muddy ground than he would have liked, but there was little to say to that. “Onions go so well with a feast for spring.”

reblog.comment:

“Not think of the onions? That would be cruel, Ser Davos.” The king’s grasp on his shoulder was powerful, pushing him further into the muddy ground than he would have liked, but there was little to say to that. “Onions go so well with a feast for spring.”
